title: Balancing code, classes, and coffee
paragraphs: This semester has been a wild mix of coding assignments, math proofs, and a constantly refilled coffee mug. Building projects for CS203 has forced me to think about structure, not just making something that barely works.

Working on this website made me realize how much I enjoy connecting design and logic. It’s satisfying to see PHP, JSON, and JavaScript all talking to each other and turning into something that feels like a real product.

title: Why I’m excited about building things on the web
paragraphs: The more I learn about web development, the more I appreciate how fast ideas can become something others can see and use. A simple change in HTML or CSS can completely change how a page feels.

Even though PHP and JavaScript can be frustrating at times, I like the feeling of slowly gaining control over the tools. Each lab adds a new piece: forms, validation, JSON, login, and now a blog that brings everything together.
